chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sterling E. Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sterling E. Cloud in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Sterling E. Cloud in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states status.  Sentence was in excess of maximum sentence.  Court needs to do re-sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Atty Masana is in agreement w/statement made by State.  Court questions DE on his understanding of this matter.  DE understands and agrees.  Court adopts recommendations and re-sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting/appeal rights and firearms warnings.

Ct 1:  
2 years prison (18 months initial confinement and 6 months extended supervision)
Consecutive to 16CF241
All other conditions would continue from previous sentencing
DE is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP
310 days credit to be applied
Racine Youthful Correction
Hearing on September 8, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sterling E. Cloud in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Sterling E. Cloud in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
